title: [K-12] Dental Education Simulation Using Problem-Based Learning: Mathematical Reasoning Integration Program

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of elementary mathematical concepts and general interest in medical simulations
context.additional_context: In limited-technology settings, using smartphones as the primary medium, emphasizing activities that transform dental case studies into mathematical problem-solving tasks.

learning_goals: Students can restructure dental treatment scenarios into mathematical problems and solve them with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can share problem-solving strategies in small online collaborative groups (4-person teams) and enhance self-directed learning abilities by 20%.
Participants can analyze patient diagnostic data using probability and statistics concepts to prioritize treatments with a 75%+ success rate.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
